topicSummary: Trichomoniasis is a sexually transmitted infection (STI) caused by the flagellated protozoanÂ Trichomonas vaginalis.

latestChanges.title: Minor update
latestChanges.body: Adverse effects updated within prescribing information - metronidazole.

latestChanges.title: Reviewed and updated
latestChanges.body: A literature search was conducted in December 2014 to identify evidence-based guidelines, UK policy systematic reviews and key RCTs published since the last review of this topic. Advice from the Clinical Effectiveness Group, British Association for Sexual Health and HIV (BASHH), United Kingdom National Guideline on the Management of Trichomoniasis vaginalis has been added to this topic. No major changes to recommendations have been made.
